Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. Job Summary
We are actively seeking a Principal Software Engineer who embodies a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workplace, fostering an environment where all team members are valued and inspired. In this role, you will take the lead in every aspect of the software development lifecycle, encompassing tasks such as estimation, technical design, implementation, documentation, testing, deployment, and ongoing support for web-based applications. As a key member of our agile team, you will be dedicated to enhancing the overall customer experience.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Provide technical leadership in the design & development of new software systems, architectures, and web-based applications using technologies such as Java, Spring Boot, Angular, and cloud platforms like Pivotal Cloud Foundry.
Analyze, test, and contribute to the integration of new applications while diligently documenting all development activities.
Research, write, and edit technical documentation and requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, and established practices relevant to assigned projects.
Deliver flexible, scalable solutions that meet evolving customer demands & proactively identify and address process, solution gaps, and other opportunities for enhancement.
Collaborate with UI Developers to create efficient, reusable, and impactful solutions.
Lead the decomposition of work in partnership with the Product Owner, ensuring that it is consumable by the team and providing technical insights and recommendations.
Support in Automating test cases to streamline software delivery and reduce the need for manual intervention, with a focus on designing easily automated solutions.
Mentor fellow developers to promote skill-building and the adoption of best practices.
Evaluate new integration patterns, frameworks, and third-party solutions, conducting research and proof-of-concept designs to assess feasibility.
Partner with Solution and Functional Architects to shape the present and future technological landscape, advocating for resolution of technical challenges encountered by the team.
Develop secure, high-performing software that meets customer accessibility standards and ensure adherence to quality standards, actively seeking opportunities for improvement.
Take a lead role in cross-product Communities of Practice and/or Guilds.
Collaborate closely with product owner and Architects to identify product & technical requirements and conduct analysis to determine integration needs.
Proactively explore and evaluate emerging technologies to advance the technical ecosystem, recommending changes based on findings.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving, analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Required Experience/Skills
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
10 years of relevant software engineering experience.
Experience working in a team environment using Agile/Scrum principles.
Knowledge of data, security, and software architecture best practices.
Familiarity with Test Driven Development & CI/CD tools.
Hands-on experience with building Microservices using Java, Spring Boot, and Kubernetes.
Expertise in database design and query optimization (e.g., MySQL or other DBMS technologies).
Familiarity with modern CI/CD automation tools like Github
Proficiency in writing automated test suites (e.g., unit tests, component tests).
Willingness to provide weekend support for releases or projects as needed.
Employees at all levels are expected to:
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Who are we?
We are Hero Trainer and we are a people-first company. We are health ecosystem for gamers - content, games, and a community.
This role is equity-based until we generate revenue, but is done at your own pace.
No minimum work hours, but on average people choose to work between 5 to 20 hrs a week depending on their other full-time job and personal life.
If there is no immediate pay, why do people work here?
The ownership of a project, building a game that truly helps people, and being part of game studio that is against pay2win and predatory practices.
Ultimately, all of this builds your experience, portfolio, and title that can be used in your career.
People stay for the culture of respect, learning, and meaningful growth.
Okay, what is the plan for payment?
Revenue share. We will be sharing revenue from different sources i.e sponsored posts for newsletter with 25K subscribers to patreon to shop revenue while we are building our game.
Who is the founder?
My name is Yash Jain and I am the founder and CEO of Hero Trainer. I don't ask anyone to do anything that I wouldn't be willing to do myself.
I read every application myself and do the first interview always. It is the least I can do to make this process more bearable.
What are we building?
We are building our 2nd game, Ever Flame, the first all-in-one health game. It combines fitness, mindfulness, diet, and sleep into a fun RPG.
Think D&D meets Animal Crossing except it gets you healthy. A huge deciding factor will be passion, work ethic, and experience.
Our game's demo is out and we are slowly progressing along.

job_title: Quality Assurance Engineer, Amazon Game Studios
job_description:
2+ years of quality assurance engineering experience
1+ years of Games Industry (supporting title Development, Release, or Live Ops) experience
Experience in automation testing
Experience in manual testing
You are a curiosity driven, detailed, and customer focused person who has experience identifying and effectively communicating issues. As a member of a Quality Assurance team you will become an expert in one or more of the game’s features and assure it meets our high quality standards. You will be expected to create reports, effectively use test tools, and work with player data to uncover new issues and more. The role of QA changes often over the course of game development, so you will need to be flexible to adapt. You will be the voice of the customer, you must be able to prioritize and categorize quality issues based on what will have the most impact on the customer experience.

Amazon is all in on games. We believe games will become the number one form of entertainment on Earth and be defined by their ability to deeply engage communities of fans inside and outside of the playing experience. We believe the evolution that began with arcade communities a quarter at a time and grew to the live streams and eSports of today, will continue to a future in which fans are creators, players are celebrities, and games are a global cultural touchstone that cuts across age, gender and nationality. Games have the power to connect communities at a massive scale. This role will empower game studios to confidently and continually release high-quality products that delight customers worldwide

Inclusive Culture, Work/Life Balance, & Career Growth
We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We offer ten employee-led affinity groups with 190 global chapters, innovative benefits, and annual and ongoing learning experiences (including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences). Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance and offers flexible working hours. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, our team is dedicated to supporting you with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice.

Key job responsibilities
Become an expert in the game's features
Develop test plans for assigned features
Report test status; coverage, defects, feature quality
Lead a group of testers through the execution of your test plans
Create new and edit existing test scripts
Leverage game telemetry to identify and troubleshoot issues
Relentlessly pursue the root-cause of defects
Prioritize and categorize quality issues based on what will have the most impact on the customer experience
Advocate for the customer in discussions with development peers and QA leadership
Continuously learn and remain curious
About the team
Amazon Games is seeking a Quality Assurance Engineer to join the New World team. New World is an open world MMO that pits players against the haunted wilderness of Aeternum, a mysterious island in the twilight of the Age of Exploration.

Please watch our New World Trailer at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKnUBs-Ko44&feature=youtu.be

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Irvine, CA, USA

Experience designing and planning test conditions, test scripts, and test data sets to ensure appropriate and adequate coverage and control
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $67,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $183,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Job Title:
Single Player Game Designer
Requisition ID:
R021864
Job Description:
Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades.
A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with.
Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision.
Your Mission
Infinity Ward is looking for an experienced Single-Player Game Designer to work on the next installment of one of the best-selling and most critically acclaimed shooter franchises of all time. If you can handle lots of ownership and responsibility, and if you’re interested in creating highly polished cinematic experiences that impactfully draw out emotion while retaining maximum player agency, we’d love to hear from you!
Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
Create compelling and immersive gameplay with innovative, memorable, and impactful moments.
Use your technical background for problem solving, systems creation, and scripting unique scenarios.
Work with an incredibly power and flexible C-style scripting language to realize your designs.
Communicate and collaborate with other disciplines such as Art, Animation, Audio, and Narrative to achieve development goals.
Player Profile
Experience
Samples of your work – links to videos with your application. We are looking for playable examples of finished shooter levels or mods.
Experience using C-style scripting languages or professional programming languages
Knowledge & Skills
Be confident and articulate; if you’re passionate about joining Infinity Ward, prove it to us.
Know our games: how they excel, where they need improvement, and how you will make them better.
A passion for cinematic language, framing, timing, and set-piece design.
Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Rewards
We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:
Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.
Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company.
In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $29.81 - $55.14 Hourly. These values reflect the expected base pay range of new hires across all U.S. locations. Ultimately, your specific range and offer will be based on several factors, including relevant experience, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share this role’s range details for your local geography during the hiring process. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

Here at TAPBLAZE, our mission is to make great games for players that will be remembered for decades. As a small team, we have created games such as "Good Pizza, Great Pizza" that have been downloaded more than 300 million times across the globe, giving a fun, innovative experience to millions of players every day. Our core values are the reason we have found success as an independent studio and guide our hiring process: we are ambitious, disciplined, ownership-minded, results oriented, and extraordinary. We operate internationally and we are growing day by day.
We are seeking individuals that have the same core values and are looking to level up themselves, the games they work on and the company they work for. Only with great attention to details can this be achieved - please mention "beauty is in the details" in your cover letter.

COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY
As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce TAPBLAZE recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with vendors and partners.

Primary duties:
A video game designer designs and storyboards new features and collaborates with the development team to create new video games. Video game designers come up with the games' concepts, characters, settings, storyline, and gameplay and work alongside the game's development team to bring their ideas to life.
Game Designer Responsibilities:
Creating innovative games for entertainment or educational purposes.
Conceptualizing and developing characters, rules, settings, and stories for new games.
Pitching new game ideas to executives and clients.
Managing multiple teams and projects.
Prototyping new games.
Following industry trends and good practices.
Monitoring work and cash flows.
Developing design and gaming protocols.
Doing quality control.
Game Designer Requirements:

Enthusiasm and knowledge of the industry.
Relevant certification in programming languages.
Portfolio of sample projects.

About the Opportunity
The Relational Agents Group at Northeastern University is an academic research laboratory that develops computer animated conversational agents that simulate face-to-face conversation between people. These agents are used primarily in health education applications across a wide range of platforms and medical interventions, most recently to promote COVID-19 vaccination on smartphones.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
We are seeking an individual whose primary responsibility is to maintain and extend an existing graphical user interface in the Unity game engine, including a significant codebase of C# software for procedural animation, media playback, and networking. This individual will: 1) integrate new models and animations; 2) develop and implement new methods for human figure rendering and animation; 3) support multiple developers and development efforts by maintaining a common code base and derivative builds in a source control system; 4) support development efforts across desktop, web, and mobile implementations; and 5) provide training and instruction for students and staff to develop applications using the interface.
QUALIFICATIONS:
A baccalaureate degree in computer science or related technical field, or five years’ professional 3D game development experience is required. A minimum of two years’ Unity and C# experience is required. Experience in human figure animation, procedural animation, and/or character modeling and rigging, are plusses, but not required. Experience working in team environments and in research environments are plusses.

Unreal projects have been leading the pack of real-time entertainment with our constantly growing team of engineering experts. We’re always improving on the tools and technology that empower content developers worldwide.
What You'll Do
We’re looking for a Gameplay Programmer who is passionate about games and well-versed in C++, gameplay systems, and optimization. In this role, you'll utilize your gameplay experience, design sensibilities, and knowledge of the Unreal Engine to push the quality and boundaries of new seasonal gameplay experiences to delight players.
In this role, you will
Work closely with technical designers building, iterating, optimizing, and bulletproofing new gameplay items and features
Prototype and iterate on features and be willing to accept and respond to critical feedback while ensuring that strong architectural and algorithmic decisions are made
Supporting technical excellence of Fortnite
Optimize and fix bugs in existing gameplay systems
Contribute ideas toward Fortnite Battle Royale’s continued production and development
Write robust, maintainable code to enable and empower other designers and engineers
What we're looking for
Experience developing games professionally and shipping AAA titles
A keen analytical mind with strong problem-solving skills
Strong C++ skills and the ability to code and architect gameplay mechanics and tools
Strong math skills
Well versed in games and the ability to articulate what is strong/weak about the design of existing games (an interest in multiplayer and live services games is preferred)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Console experience
Experience working on a live service game
Self-motivated, strong work ethic, and able to work independently
Creativity in problem-solving and the ability to think outside of the established solutions & a keen interest in games
EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents. Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we’ve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic’s award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer.
Note to Recruitment Agencies: Epic does not accept any unsolicited resumes or approaches from any unauthorized third party (including recruitment or placement agencies) (i.e., a third party with whom we do not have a negotiated and validly executed agreement). We will not pay any fees to any unauthorized third party.

Welcome to Maxis, home to tinkerers, craftspeople, & storytellers. Our drive is to inspire everyone to make a better world through creative play. As the developer of The Sims, we create games and experiences for millions of people around the world and are always looking for new ways to inspire our players. Maxis is a place where you can do what you love and help others grow while doing it; a place where your unique voice can be heard and seen. We put creativity and inclusivity at the core of our work and don't settle for seeing the world only as it is, but strive to build a world as it could be.
Teams are building the next generation game and creative platform, Project Rene and reimagining The Sims that players know and love with even more new ways to play. We're excited you're interested to learn more about how you can join our team and dream big.
You will be reporting to the Development Director
As a game designer on creative tools with Maxis, you will guide the implementation of the tools and content to shape our game world, from the Sims themselves to the environments they live in. This will involve working with cross-discipline groups toward a common defined vision and supporting efforts with design documentation and technical implementation.
Responsibilities
You will develop designs that define the content in the world, including characters and environments, in close partnership with the art and simulation design teams.
You will oversee the design and execution of your features from concept through execution, including technical implementation, tuning, and bug fixing.
You will design tools, create content, and build a world that supports the game systems, narrative, and liveops needs of the game.
You will create designs for both internal and external creative tools.
You will write detailed and maintainable design documentation.
You will become knowledgeable in and help improve Maxis' proprietary game designer development tools to implement your designs, tune, and bug fix.
You will ensure that environments, objects, and other assets are compatible with simulation gameplay and implement the necessary functionality using proprietary tools.
You will collaborate with all team disciplines, including artists, animators, modelers, engineers, quality assurance, and producers to get support from the team and guide a project from initial design to final production.
You will partner with Experience Design to make complex features into delightful and easy to understand experiences for players.
You will partner with Development Directors to track tasks, identify risk, and clarify changes in design work.
Qualifications
4-6 years of game design experience.
Experience designing creative tools or gameplay and features focused on player customization, creativity, and self-expression.
Experience designing content to support liveops, game systems, and narrative needs.
Expertise in game development tools and engines, especially Unreal.
Implemented designs in past games using scripts, blueprints, or in an editor.
Excellent creative, analytical, with an ability to write detailed design documentation.
Experience designing or creating requirements for internal and external tools.
Design and implementation experience with game features that focus on open-ended player creativity.
Comfortable with multiple stages of development, from pre-production through live service.
Desirable Skills
Experience in Unreal.
Technical Design, scripting, modding, or engineering background.
3D level design, character design, or game art background.
Worked on a AAA HD title in a content or creative tools-focused role.
Familiarity with games that feature creative tools, creator economies, and popular modding communities. (e.g. Roblox, Minecraft, The Sims Resource)
Experience with games in The Sims PC franchise or other games with player customization and creativity tools.
Visit us at: https://www.ea.com/ea-studios/maxis

Comcast Business offers technology solutions ranging from Ethernet, internet, and WiFi connectivity to voice, television, and managed Enterprise solutions to power businesses of all sizes to perform better. Job Summary
We are actively seeking a Principal Software Engineer who embodies a commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion in our workplace, fostering an environment where all team members are valued and inspired. In this role, you will take the lead in every aspect of the software development lifecycle, encompassing tasks such as estimation, technical design, implementation, documentation, testing, deployment, and ongoing support for web-based applications. As a key member of our agile team, you will be dedicated to enhancing the overall customer experience.
Job Description
Core Responsibilities
Provide technical leadership in the design & development of new software systems, architectures, and web-based applications using technologies such as Java, Spring Boot, Angular, and cloud platforms like Pivotal Cloud Foundry.
Analyze, test, and contribute to the integration of new applications while diligently documenting all development activities.
Research, write, and edit technical documentation and requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, and established practices relevant to assigned projects.
Deliver flexible, scalable solutions that meet evolving customer demands & proactively identify and address process, solution gaps, and other opportunities for enhancement.
Collaborate with UI Developers to create efficient, reusable, and impactful solutions.
Lead the decomposition of work in partnership with the Product Owner, ensuring that it is consumable by the team and providing technical insights and recommendations.
Support in Automating test cases to streamline software delivery and reduce the need for manual intervention, with a focus on designing easily automated solutions.
Mentor fellow developers to promote skill-building and the adoption of best practices.
Evaluate new integration patterns, frameworks, and third-party solutions, conducting research and proof-of-concept designs to assess feasibility.
Partner with Solution and Functional Architects to shape the present and future technological landscape, advocating for resolution of technical challenges encountered by the team.
Develop secure, high-performing software that meets customer accessibility standards and ensure adherence to quality standards, actively seeking opportunities for improvement.
Take a lead role in cross-product Communities of Practice and/or Guilds.
Collaborate closely with product owner and Architects to identify product & technical requirements and conduct analysis to determine integration needs.
Proactively explore and evaluate emerging technologies to advance the technical ecosystem, recommending changes based on findings.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving, analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Required Experience/Skills
Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field, or equivalent experience.
10 years of relevant software engineering experience.
Experience working in a team environment using Agile/Scrum principles.
Knowledge of data, security, and software architecture best practices.
Familiarity with Test Driven Development & CI/CD tools.
Hands-on experience with building Microservices using Java, Spring Boot, and Kubernetes.
Expertise in database design and query optimization (e.g., MySQL or other DBMS technologies).
Familiarity with modern CI/CD automation tools like Github
Proficiency in writing automated test suites (e.g., unit tests, component tests).
Willingness to provide weekend support for releases or projects as needed.
Employees at all levels are expected to:
Understand our Operating Principles; make them the guidelines for how you do your job.
Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.
Know your stuff - be enthusiastic learners, users and advocates of our game-changing technology, products and services, especially our digital tools and experiences.
Win as a team - make big things happen by working together and being open to new ideas.
Be an active part of the Net Promoter System - a way of working that brings more employee and customer feedback into the company - by joining huddles, making call backs and helping us elevate opportunities to do better for our customers.
Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

**Your application will NOT be reviewed, if you do not answer the questions**
Who are we?
We are Hero Trainer and we are a people-first company. We are health ecosystem for gamers - content, games, and a community.
This role is equity-based until we generate revenue, but is done at your own pace.
No minimum work hours, but on average people choose to work between 5 to 20 hrs a week depending on their other full-time job and personal life.
If there is no immediate pay, why do people work here?
The ownership of a project, building a game that truly helps people, and being part of game studio that is against pay2win and predatory practices.
Ultimately, all of this builds your experience, portfolio, and title that can be used in your career.
People stay for the culture of respect, learning, and meaningful growth.
Okay, what is the plan for payment?
Revenue share. We will be sharing revenue from different sources i.e sponsored posts for newsletter with 25K subscribers to patreon to shop revenue while we are building our game.
Who is the founder?
My name is Yash Jain and I am the founder and CEO of Hero Trainer. I don't ask anyone to do anything that I wouldn't be willing to do myself.
I read every application myself and do the first interview always. It is the least I can do to make this process more bearable.
What are we building?
We are building our 2nd game, Ever Flame, the first all-in-one health game. It combines fitness, mindfulness, diet, and sleep into a fun RPG.
Think D&D meets Animal Crossing except it gets you healthy. A huge deciding factor will be passion, work ethic, and experience.
Our game's demo is out and we are slowly progressing along.

Show ownership and be accountable for the development of new features
Challenge our production pipeline and suggest improvements for creating the best hybrid casual games on the maket
Implement and maintain APIs, databases, and server-side systems to support game functionality.
Participate in the full development lifecycle, including planning, design, development, testing, and deployment.
Document and maintain technical specifications, guidelines, and best practices.
Requirements:

Experience with Unity, specifically on mobile platforms, and usage of its scripting APIs, 2D tools, UI and animations.
Experience with object-oriented programming using design patterns, algorithms and data structures.
Excellent problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
Passion for gaming and wellness, with a commitment to creating engaging experiences.
Bonus points if you have character rigging and animation experience
Check us out at: herotrainer.io or our twitter: @herotrainerinc.
A great way to score points with us is by engaging with our Twitter, @playeverflame, and our Discord. Do not say you're searching for a job on either of those channels.

About Us

Easy Games is an independent game development studio with a massive audience. We’ve grown our audience to over 20M monthly users and reached heights of more than 350k concurrent players. We have already published two successful games and are planning to release many more. Our games are all multiplayer focused and consistently updated.
Our engineering team is rapidly expanding and we are looking for talented developers that are passionate about gaming and building quality software. You will help us grow our current games and also build new games on the Roblox platform.
Our Stack
We use some Roblox specific tools and frameworks that will likely be unfamiliar. Because of this, it is essential that you be willing to learn and ask questions. Our primary programming language is TypeScript, a modern typed language similar to C#. Our TypeScript code is transpiled into Lua, but you are not expected to be familiar with Lua.
Expectations
This role is a creative position. When you own a feature, you will work alongside others to take it through ideation to production. Your creative vision and initiative is essential to this process.
As a Gameplay Programmer at Easy Games, your responsibilities will primarily include:
Creating new features such as combat mechanics, skill systems, user interface, etc.
Polishing or tuning existing game features
Working with artists, designers, and other developers
Owning entire aspects of the gameplay experience even after deployment
Creating reusable gameplay systems
Our development team works in weekly or bi-weekly release cycles. An ideal team member can be assigned one or more new features at the beginning of the cycle and have the features completed and ready for release by the end of the cycle. Checkout Roblox Bedwars and Roblox Islands to see our games and some of our most recent updates.
The Fit
You may be a good fit for our team if you have:
3-5 years of gameplay programming or software engineering experience
Experience working with game engines and game development concepts
A passion for game design
Ability to communicate ideas and suggestions for creating fun gameplay

Job Summary
Responsible for planning and designing new software and web applications. Analyzes, tests and assists with the integration of new applications. Oversees the documentation of all development activity. Trains non-technical personnel. Assists with tracking performance metrics. Provides guidance and support to other Engineers. Integrates knowledge of business and functional priorities. Acts as a key contributor in a complex and crucial environment. May lead teams or projects and shares expertise. Xumo, a joint venture between Comcast and Charter, was formed to develop and offer a next-generation streaming platform on a variety of branded 4K streaming devices and smart TVs. Powered by Comcast’s global technology platform, Xumo devices and services feature an entertainment experience designed to make it easy for consumers to find and enjoy their favorite streaming content through a world-class user interface and voice search, and for partners to meaningfully connect and engage with millions of consumers.
Job Description
Additional Job Summary/Info:
We are seeking an experienced Principal Frontend Server Engineer to lead with design, engineering, and integration of frontend applications for our in-house Content Management System (CMS).
As the Principal Frontend Engineer for the Xumo Software Engineering Team, you’ll lead the development of frontend application/infrastructure within the field of CMS. The role will require strong skills with frontend development, developing application for allowing users to intuitively and flexible programing with content partners provided video contents, that will be distributed to millions of viewers through streaming devices. To succeed in this role, its necessary to continuously provide clear technical solutions which satisfies the business requirements of the product and operation team.
Position is office based in Irvine, CA- 4 days/week & 1 day/week, virtual.
Position Duties:
Lead architect, design, develop the application for Content Management System
Collaborate with product and operation team to collect requirements for update/new features, and share technical solution using documentation that includes diagrams, that can be broken down as development tasks to share with multiple developers.
Develop new product/feature concepts and deliver prototypes with Product and Operation team. Gather and finalize software requirements based on business and product requirements by translating design and wireframes into high-quality code.
Manage the front-end development.
Design and develop applications with high-quality web solutions that interact and manage scalable content/records through custom built APIs.
Manage implementation for new features and maintaining existing code, designing software solutions that meet the project requirements, refactoring existing code, writing tests, and fixing bugs.
Collaborate with backend server team to manage the APIs to interact and make efficiency with application to operate. Discuss requirements and priorities, best approach, and solution.
Develop and provide technical documents for CMS on both internal and external to explain the specification of interface to interact with servers.
Make decisions about what approach appropriate to solve the business/product problem by extending our feature set, managing a reusable component library, and improving our user experience.
Qualifications
8+ years’ experience of developing UI components and API for a CMS
8+ years’ experience of JavaScript using React.js, Redux, Next.js, and Sass
8+ years’ experience of JS unit testing tools like Jest and Mocha
8+ years’ experience of managing code using GitHub.
8+ years’ experience of implementing apps using web service APIs (REST/SOAP) and HTTP/SSL protocol.
5+ years’ experience of using database (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, MongoDB)
5+ years’ experience of working with Linux-based operation system (CentOS, OSX)
Strong leads with designing and implementation skills to approach the solution for any new features or problem solving.
Self-starter and able to work with minimal supervision to create quality output.
Good communication skills for understanding and discussing complex topics with remote teammates.
Desirable Experiences
Experience manipulating video contents (content metadata, caption file, video format file, etc.)
Knowledge of various video formats: HLS, MP4, Mpeg-Dash
Experience developing microservices (Docker) on Kubernetes
Experience operating servers on cloud-based environments (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure)
Experience developing scalable and highly available applications.
Core Responsibilities
Collaborates with project stakeholders to identify product and technical requirements. Conducts analysis to determine integration needs.
Designs new software and web applications, supports applications under development and customizes current applications. Develops software update processes for existing applications. Assists in the roll-out of software releases.
Trains junior Software Development Engineers on internally developed software applications.
Oversees the researching, writing and editing of documentation and technical requirements, including software designs, evaluation plans, test results, technical manuals and formal recommendations and reports.
Keeps current with technological developments within the industry. Monitors and evaluates competitive applications and products. Reviews literature, patents and current practices relevant to the solution of assigned projects.
Assists with technical leadership throughout the design process and assists in guidance with regards to practices, procedures and techniques. Serves as a guide mentor for Software Development Engineers.
Assists in tracking and evaluating performance metrics. Ensures team delivers software on time, to specification and within budget.
Works with Quality Assurance team to determine if applications fit specification and technical requirements. Tests and evaluates systems, subsystems and components.
Acts as a technical contact and liaison for outside vendors and/or customers.
Presents and defends architectural, design and technical choices to internal and external audiences.
Consistent exercise of independent judgment and discretion in matters of significance.
Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) and overtime as necessary.
Other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Own the customer experience - think and act in ways that put our customers first, give them seamless digital options at every touchpoint, and make them promoters of our products and services.

Drive results and growth.
Respect and promote inclusion & diversity.
Do what's right for each other, our customers, investors and our communities.

Klein Buendel is a small woman-owned business in metro Denver specializing in the research and development of effective health communication programs and technologies to promote health behavior and prevent chronic disease.
The purpose of this position is to support behavioral research with the development of web-based, educational, single-player games for youth and adult health promotion. The position is exempt, non-temporary, full-time/40 hours per week, and hybrid in-office 2 days per week.
We are looking to hire a creative and enthusiastic game developer to design exciting new video games for our company and collaborators. You will work with other members of our creative/development team to develop web-based, educational, single-player games for youth and adults related to general health and mental health promotion. You will be responsible for creating the overall game storyline, building character biographies, constructing the base engine, designing specific role-play mechanics, contributing to audio and graphic design, creating the game specs, and fixing bugs prior to the final game release. To ensure success as a game developer, you should have strong artistic skills, sound working knowledge of coding software, and be able to work as part of a team to meet desired specifications and goals.

Design and develop IT-based web programs and computer games that combine text with sound, graphics, video, and digital animation.

Create initial storylines and character biographies; generate storyboards and game scripts.
Animate game characters and environment.
Construct game base engines; translate ideas into efficient code; and maintain code and fix bugs.
Create game quality unit tests.
Contribute to audio and graphic design.
Aid in the identification and implementation of new technologies that will enhance
the effectiveness and impact of electronic program delivery.

Bachelor’s degree in computer science or software engineering, or equivalent work experience.
Proven work experience completing a full video game life-cycle.
Skill using appropriate design packages such as Adobe Animate, Character Animator, AfterEffects, Premier, Audition, Photoshop, and Illustrator. 3D tools such as Canvas, or three.js., as well as gaming engines such as Unity, and web development tools like WebAssembly, or WebGL.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Java or C++.
Proficient with HTML/CSS/JS and/or other modern front-end frameworks
Excellent knowledge of APIs and build libraries.
Knowledge of the latest gaming trends and technologies.
Able to work collaboratively as part of a hybrid creative team.
Strong artistic and graphic design skills.
Ability to solve complicated problems using best practices

Location:
This VR Game Developer Panel will be conducted remotely.
About:
Interpret LLC, a video game research firm, presents the Game Developer Panel as part of their Good Gamer Group. This specialized community assembles seasoned game developers who share an undying passion for crafting exceptional gaming experiences. Our mission is to delve deep into the game development process and optimize tools by incorporating the feedback from professionals like you.
Over the past years, our diverse research undertakings have made significant strides in understanding the needs of gamers. In 2022 alone, we orchestrated over 1,081 video game-specific studies. Since 2020, our incentive program has remunerated Good Gamer Group members with a staggering $2.2 million.
These opportunities apply specifically to our Game Developer VR Panel and you will only be given studies related to game development or game art / design.
Responsibilities:
Engage in an assortment of studies encompassing surveys, interviews, focus groups, and developmental tool tests.
Share invaluable feedback and insights on game development tools, their efficacy, and potential enhancements.
Uphold the confidentiality protocols of each study and respect the privacy guidelines set by Interpret LLC.
Maintain punctuality and reliability for all scheduled studies.
This panel operates on an ad-hoc basis and doesn't offer full-time employment. The specificity of requirements varies with each study. Participants are matched with studies based on their Game Developer Panel profile. All studies, be it in-person or virtual, necessitate a re-screening to validate a member's qualifications prior to their participation.
Qualifications:
Expertise in Game Development: Prospective members should possess a minimum of 3 years of experience in game development.
Articulation: Ability to clearly convey opinions, experiences, and insights.
Critical Evaluation: Proficiency in evaluating game tools, their usability, and potential implications.
Open-mindedness: A willingness to explore and provide feedback on diverse game development tools.
Team Collaboration: Ability to foster a healthy group dynamic, respect diverse opinions, and contribute constructively to discussions.
Integrity: Members are expected to uphold the confidentiality of studies, consistently participate, and provide authentic, comprehensive feedback.
Requirements:
Minimum 3 years in VR game development.
Function in at least one of the following roles: Game Designer, Programmer/Developer, Level Designer, UI/UX, System Engineer, Art and Sound Integration Specialist, 3D Modeling, Animation, Producer, Technical Artist, AI Programming, Graphics/Rendering Engineer, Gameplay Programmer, Tools Developer, Middleware Developer, Share Developer, Network Engineer.
Experience developing Virtual, Augmented, or Mixed Reality games a plus!
Experience with game engines such as Unity, Unreal Engine, Roblox Studio, VR Chat, Lumberyard, or similar professional game development engines.
Familiarity with notable programming languages such as C++, Java, Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, Lua, etc.
Or familiarity in tools used for Animation, 3D Modeling, Texture Artists, Skydomes, etc.
Reside in the U.S.
Compensation:
This being a specialized panel, incentives are higher than our general gaming panel. Approximate compensations are:
Surveys: $20 to $50
Interviews: $150 to $600
Focus Groups: $250 to $600
Development Tool Tests: $250 to $2,000

job_title: Quality Assurance Engineer, Amazon Game Studios
job_description:
2+ years of quality assurance engineering experience
1+ years of Games Industry (supporting title Development, Release, or Live Ops) experience
Experience in automation testing
Experience in manual testing
You are a curiosity driven, detailed, and customer focused person who has experience identifying and effectively communicating issues. As a member of a Quality Assurance team you will become an expert in one or more of the game’s features and assure it meets our high quality standards. You will be expected to create reports, effectively use test tools, and work with player data to uncover new issues and more. The role of QA changes often over the course of game development, so you will need to be flexible to adapt. You will be the voice of the customer, you must be able to prioritize and categorize quality issues based on what will have the most impact on the customer experience.

Amazon is all in on games. We believe games will become the number one form of entertainment on Earth and be defined by their ability to deeply engage communities of fans inside and outside of the playing experience. We believe the evolution that began with arcade communities a quarter at a time and grew to the live streams and eSports of today, will continue to a future in which fans are creators, players are celebrities, and games are a global cultural touchstone that cuts across age, gender and nationality. Games have the power to connect communities at a massive scale. This role will empower game studios to confidently and continually release high-quality products that delight customers worldwide

Inclusive Culture, Work/Life Balance, & Career Growth
We embrace our differences and are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We offer ten employee-led affinity groups with 190 global chapters, innovative benefits, and annual and ongoing learning experiences (including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences). Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance and offers flexible working hours. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. Additionally, our team is dedicated to supporting you with mentorship and pathways for ongoing development. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and are building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and promotes career choice.

Key job responsibilities
Become an expert in the game's features
Develop test plans for assigned features
Report test status; coverage, defects, feature quality
Lead a group of testers through the execution of your test plans
Create new and edit existing test scripts
Leverage game telemetry to identify and troubleshoot issues
Relentlessly pursue the root-cause of defects
Prioritize and categorize quality issues based on what will have the most impact on the customer experience
Advocate for the customer in discussions with development peers and QA leadership
Continuously learn and remain curious
About the team
Amazon Games is seeking a Quality Assurance Engineer to join the New World team. New World is an open world MMO that pits players against the haunted wilderness of Aeternum, a mysterious island in the twilight of the Age of Exploration.

Please watch our New World Trailer at: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OKnUBs-Ko44&feature=youtu.be

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Irvine, CA, USA

Experience designing and planning test conditions, test scripts, and test data sets to ensure appropriate and adequate coverage and control
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $67,300/year in our lowest geographic market up to $183,100/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Job Title:
Single Player Game Designer
Requisition ID:
R021864
Job Description:
Founded in 2002, Infinity Ward is the original studio behind the Call of Duty® franchise. The titles developed by Infinity Ward have won more than 200 "Game of the Year" awards and 100 "Editor's Choice" awards, among many other industry accolades.
A critically acclaimed studio, Infinity Ward is proud to have one of the most passionate and talented development teams in the industry. We love to have as much fun as the games we create, and it shows in our relaxed, yet diligent, workplace environment. We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we like to look after ours. We enjoy having fun with top-notch events that everyone gets involved with.
Infinity Ward is wholly owned by Activision.
Your Mission
Infinity Ward is looking for an experienced Single-Player Game Designer to work on the next installment of one of the best-selling and most critically acclaimed shooter franchises of all time. If you can handle lots of ownership and responsibility, and if you’re interested in creating highly polished cinematic experiences that impactfully draw out emotion while retaining maximum player agency, we’d love to hear from you!
Priorities can often change in a fast-paced environment like ours, so this role includes, but is not limited to, the following responsibilities:
Create compelling and immersive gameplay with innovative, memorable, and impactful moments.
Use your technical background for problem solving, systems creation, and scripting unique scenarios.
Work with an incredibly power and flexible C-style scripting language to realize your designs.
Communicate and collaborate with other disciplines such as Art, Animation, Audio, and Narrative to achieve development goals.
Player Profile
Experience
Samples of your work – links to videos with your application. We are looking for playable examples of finished shooter levels or mods.
Experience using C-style scripting languages or professional programming languages
Knowledge & Skills
Be confident and articulate; if you’re passionate about joining Infinity Ward, prove it to us.
Know our games: how they excel, where they need improvement, and how you will make them better.
A passion for cinematic language, framing, timing, and set-piece design.
Our World
Activision Blizzard, Inc. (NASDAQ: ATVI), is one of the world's largest and most successful interactive entertainment companies and is at the intersection of media, technology and entertainment. We are home to some of the most beloved entertainment franchises including Call of Duty®, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Diablo®, Candy Crush™ and Bubble Witch™. Our combined entertainment network delights hundreds of millions of monthly active users in 196 countries, making us the largest gaming network on the planet!
Our ability to build immersive and innovate worlds is only enhanced by diverse teams working in an inclusive environment. We aspire to have a culture where everyone can thrive in order to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment. We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered!
The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.
We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply.
Infinity Ward is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Rewards
We provide a suite of benefits that promote physical, emotional and financial well-being for ‘Every World’ - we’ve got our employees covered! Subject to eligibility requirements, the Company offers comprehensive benefits including:
Medical, dental, vision, health savings account or health reimbursement account, healthcare spending accounts, dependent care spending accounts, life and AD&D insurance, disability insurance;
401(k) with Company match, tuition reimbursement, charitable donation matching;
Paid holidays and vacation, paid sick time, floating holidays, compassion and bereavement leaves, parental leave;
Mental health & wellbeing programs, fitness programs, free and discounted games, and a variety of other voluntary benefit programs like supplemental life & disability, legal service, ID protection, rental insurance, and others;
If the Company requires that you move geographic locations for the job, then you may also be eligible for relocation assistance.
Eligibility to participate in these benefits may vary for part time and temporary full-time employees and interns with the Company.
In the U.S., the standard base pay range for this role is $29.81 - $55.14 Hourly. These values reflect the expected base pay range of new hires across all U.S. locations. Ultimately, your specific range and offer will be based on several factors, including relevant experience, performance, and work location. Your Talent Professional can share this role’s range details for your local geography during the hiring process. In addition to a competitive base pay, employees in this role may be eligible for incentive compensation. Incentive compensation is not guaranteed.

job_title: Student XR Game Developer - Student Clerical
job_description:
Job Summary
The XR Game Developer will aid Instructional Innovations’ Senior XR Developer in developing, testing, and maintaining XR content for the university. In this role, students will interface with game engine technology to create engaging interactions and immersive environments.

The successful candidate will be expected to produce content with guidance from the Senior XR Developer. They will be required to build trust by maintaining confidential materials, and will need to show developed problem-solving skills.
Job Duties
Integration and organization of art assets from student artists
Level design, scripting, and quality assurance
Using in-house content creation tools within Unity to develop XR experiences for the classroom
Working hours are flexible. This is a remote position.
Candidate Requirements
Strong understanding of real-time 3D tools such as Unity, Unreal, or Godot
Able to work 10-20 hours per week
Foundational understanding of 3D asset pipelines (modeling, texturing, rigging, animation)
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Effective written and verbal communication skills
Foundational understanding of programming languages such as C# or C++
Preferred
Proficiency with Unity and C#
Level design and/or quality assurance experience
Experience using VR equipment
FLSA Status
Non-Exempt

POSITION SUMMARY
We have an immediate need for an experienced C++ game programmer to join our engineering team and work on our hit game, “Good Pizza, Great Pizza”. You will work on new game features, help maintain/improve current game code/vitals and help port the game to different platforms. We are looking for ambitious, results oriented individuals to join our team.
The qualified individual will work with the rest of the team to further scale “Good Pizza, Great Pizza” and launch new game titles.
ABOUT TAPBLAZE
Here at TAPBLAZE, our mission is to make great games for players that will be remembered for decades. As a small team, we have created games such as "Good Pizza, Great Pizza" that have been downloaded more than 300 million times across the globe, giving a fun, innovative experience to millions of players every day. Our core values are the reason we have found success as an independent studio and guide our hiring process: we are ambitious, disciplined, ownership-minded, results oriented, and extraordinary. We operate internationally and we are growing day by day.
We are seeking individuals that have the same core values and are looking to level up themselves, the games they work on and the company they work for. Only with great attention to details can this be achieved - please mention "beauty is in the details" in your cover letter.
OBJECTIVES
Develop Mobile/Steam/Console games using C++ and related game engines
Collaborate with the design team to create and produce new games
Maintain coding standards and write clean, readable, and easily maintainable code
Gets things done on time
COMPETENCIES
Proficient in C++
Solid understanding of coding fundamentals
Able to come up with efficient solutions for engineering issues
Prioritize work based on player view point, company objectives and timelines
Exceptional attention to detail is a must; in your application/cover letter please mention the phrase “beauty is in the details”
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE
1 years of experience developing with C++
Pluses: Bachelor or Master (BS/MS) degree in STEM-related field
Pluses: Experience with Cocos2D-x is a major plus
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Los Angeles, CA: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work
Prolonged period of time sitting at a desk and computer
COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY
As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce TAPBLAZE recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with vendors and partners.
If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, include a cover letter in your application explaining why you would be a great fit.

Welcome to Maxis, home to tinkerers, craftspeople, & storytellers. Our drive is to inspire everyone to make a better world through creative play. As the developer of The Sims, we create games and experiences for millions of people around the world and are always looking for new ways to inspire our players. Maxis is a place where you can do what you love and help others grow while doing it; a place where your unique voice can be heard and seen. We put creativity and inclusivity at the core of our work and don't settle for seeing the world only as it is, but strive to build a world as it could be.
Teams are building the next generation game and creative platform, Project Rene and reimagining The Sims that players know and love with even more new ways to play. We're excited you're interested to learn more about how you can join our team and dream big.
You will be reporting to the Development Director
As a game designer on creative tools with Maxis, you will guide the implementation of the tools and content to shape our game world, from the Sims themselves to the environments they live in. This will involve working with cross-discipline groups toward a common defined vision and supporting efforts with design documentation and technical implementation.
Responsibilities
You will develop designs that define the content in the world, including characters and environments, in close partnership with the art and simulation design teams.
You will oversee the design and execution of your features from concept through execution, including technical implementation, tuning, and bug fixing.
You will design tools, create content, and build a world that supports the game systems, narrative, and liveops needs of the game.
You will create designs for both internal and external creative tools.
You will write detailed and maintainable design documentation.
You will become knowledgeable in and help improve Maxis' proprietary game designer development tools to implement your designs, tune, and bug fix.
You will ensure that environments, objects, and other assets are compatible with simulation gameplay and implement the necessary functionality using proprietary tools.
You will collaborate with all team disciplines, including artists, animators, modelers, engineers, quality assurance, and producers to get support from the team and guide a project from initial design to final production.
You will partner with Experience Design to make complex features into delightful and easy to understand experiences for players.
You will partner with Development Directors to track tasks, identify risk, and clarify changes in design work.
Qualifications
4-6 years of game design experience.
Experience designing creative tools or gameplay and features focused on player customization, creativity, and self-expression.
Experience designing content to support liveops, game systems, and narrative needs.
Expertise in game development tools and engines, especially Unreal.
Implemented designs in past games using scripts, blueprints, or in an editor.
Excellent creative, analytical, with an ability to write detailed design documentation.
Experience designing or creating requirements for internal and external tools.
Design and implementation experience with game features that focus on open-ended player creativity.
Comfortable with multiple stages of development, from pre-production through live service.
Desirable Skills
Experience in Unreal.
Technical Design, scripting, modding, or engineering background.
3D level design, character design, or game art background.
Worked on a AAA HD title in a content or creative tools-focused role.
Familiarity with games that feature creative tools, creator economies, and popular modding communities. (e.g. Roblox, Minecraft, The Sims Resource)
Experience with games in The Sims PC franchise or other games with player customization and creativity tools.
Visit us at: https://www.ea.com/ea-studios/maxis

We are a global team of creators, storytellers, technologists, experience originators, innovators and so much more. We believe amazing games and experiences start with teams as diverse as the players and communities we serve. At Electronic Arts, the only limit is your imagination.

Primary duties:
A video game designer designs and storyboards new features and collaborates with the development team to create new video games. Video game designers come up with the games' concepts, characters, settings, storyline, and gameplay and work alongside the game's development team to bring their ideas to life.
Game Designer Responsibilities:
Creating innovative games for entertainment or educational purposes.
Conceptualizing and developing characters, rules, settings, and stories for new games.
Pitching new game ideas to executives and clients.
Managing multiple teams and projects.
Prototyping new games.
Following industry trends and good practices.
Monitoring work and cash flows.
Developing design and gaming protocols.
Doing quality control.
Game Designer Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in game design, computer science, or computer engineering.
Enthusiasm and knowledge of the industry.
Relevant certification in programming languages.
Portfolio of sample projects.

About the Opportunity
The Relational Agents Group at Northeastern University is an academic research laboratory that develops computer animated conversational agents that simulate face-to-face conversation between people. These agents are used primarily in health education applications across a wide range of platforms and medical interventions, most recently to promote COVID-19 vaccination on smartphones.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
We are seeking an individual whose primary responsibility is to maintain and extend an existing graphical user interface in the Unity game engine, including a significant codebase of C# software for procedural animation, media playback, and networking. This individual will: 1) integrate new models and animations; 2) develop and implement new methods for human figure rendering and animation; 3) support multiple developers and development efforts by maintaining a common code base and derivative builds in a source control system; 4) support development efforts across desktop, web, and mobile implementations; and 5) provide training and instruction for students and staff to develop applications using the interface.
QUALIFICATIONS:
A baccalaureate degree in computer science or related technical field, or five years’ professional 3D game development experience is required. A minimum of two years’ Unity and C# experience is required. Experience in human figure animation, procedural animation, and/or character modeling and rigging, are plusses, but not required. Experience working in team environments and in research environments are plusses.
Documents to Submit:
Resume and Cover Letter
Position Type
Information Technology

Northeastern has a comprehensive benefits package for benefit eligible employees. This includes medical, vision, dental, paid time off, tuition assistance, wellness & life, retirement- as well as commuting & transportation. Visit
https://hr.northeastern.edu/benefits/
for more information.

.
